contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox zoo |zoo_name = Monkey Sanctuary |logo = |logo_caption = |image = |image_caption = |location = [[Looe]], [[Cornwall]], [[England]] |date_opened = 1964 |date_closed = |coordinates = {{Coord|50.3654|-4.4136|type:landmark_scale:1000|display=it}} |area = |num_species = 3<ref name="monkeys"/> |num_animals = 36<ref name="monkeys"/> |largest_tank_vol = |total_tank_vol = |annual_visitors = 30,000<ref name="bbc"/> |members = |exhibits = |website = {{URL|http://www.monkeysanctuary.org}} }} The '''Monkey Sanctuary''' was founded in 1964 by Len Williams, father of [[John Williams (guitarist)]], as a [[cooperative]] to care for rescued [[woolly monkey]]s. Based in [[Looe]], [[Cornwall]], [[England]], the sanctuary is home to woolly monkeys that are descended from the original rescued pets, a growing number of [[capuchin monkeys]] rescued from the current UK pet trade,<ref name="bbc">{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/cornwall/content/articles/2008/07/29/nature_monkeyaward_feature.shtml |title=Gold for Sanctuary |work=bbc.co.uk |publisher=[[BBC]] |date=29 July 2008 |accessdate=9 February 2013 }}</ref> and a small group of rescued [[Barbary macaque]]s.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.monkeysanctuary.org/barbary-macaques/ |title=Barbary Macaques |work=monkeysanctuary.org |publisher=The Monkey Sanctuary |accessdate=9 February 2013 }}</ref> The monkeys live in large enclosures that the general public can view during the summer months when the sanctuary. There is a colony of rare [[lesser horseshoe bat]]s living in the cellar of Murrayton House, a 19th century building that is the visitors' centre and accommodation for staff and volunteers. The bats can be observed from the "bat cave", a room that shows CCTV footage from an infrared camera installed in the cellar.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.monkeysanctuary.org/the-sanctuary/batcave-wildlife-room/ |title=Bat Cave & Wildlife Room |work=monkeysanctuary.org |publisher=The Monkey Sanctuary |accessdate=9 February 2013 }}</ref> The Monkey Sanctuary is the flagship project of Wild Futures<ref name="wildfutures">{{cite web |url=http://www.wildfutures.org/ |title= Wild Futures |work=wildfutures.org |publisher=Wild Futures |accessdate = 9 February 2013}}</ref> (UK registered Charity number 1102532<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.charity-commission.gov.uk/Showcharity/RegisterOfCharities/CharityWithoutPartB.aspx?RegisteredCharityNumber=1102532&SubsidiaryNumber=0 |title=1102532 - Wild Futures |work=charity-commission.gov.uk |publisher=United Kingdom Charity Commission |accessdate=9 February 2013 }}</ref>). Wild Futures is dedicated to promoting the welfare, conservation and survival of [[primates]].<ref name="wildfutures"/> Wild Futures campaigns to end the primate trade in the UK and abroad, and to end the abuse of primates in captivity. Through talking to visitors, schools and other groups, they aim to educate the public and raise awareness about the issues primates face in captivity and in the wild, and to promote and support [[Wildlife management|conservation]] efforts worldwide. ==Notes== {{reflist |refs= <ref name="monkeys">{{cite web |url=http://www.monkeysanctuary.org/the-sanctuary/monkeys/ |title=Monkeys |work=monkeysanctuary.org |publisher=The Monkey Sanctuary |accessdate=9 February 2013 }}</ref> }} ==References== * {{cite web |url=http://www.newscientist.com/article/mg12617133.600--more-room-for-the-woollies-the-monkey-sanctuary-at-looe-in-cornwall-has-been-so-successful-that-it-must-now-expand-and-perhaps-divide-what-lessons-does-it-hold-for-traditional-zoos--.html |title=More room for the woollies: The Monkey Sanctuary at Looe in Cornwall has been so successful that it must now expand and perhaps divide. What lessons does it hold for traditional zoos? |first=Colin |last=Tudge |work=newscientist.com |publisher=New Scientist |date=21 April 1990 |accessdate=9 January 2013 }} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.monkeysanctuary.org}} * [http://www.wildfutures.org Wild Futures] {{Zoos}} [[Category:Animal charities based in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Cornwall]] [[Category:Co-operatives in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1964]] [[Category:Primate sanctuaries]] [[Category:Visitor attractions in Cornwall]] [[Category:Zoos in England]]
